revised_title: Exploring the Zig-Zag Structure of Hydrocarbon Chains and its Impact on Odd and Even Numbered Compounds
tldr: The authors investigate the connection between the zig-zag structure of hydrocarbon chains and the alternation in the physical properties of odd and even numbered chain compounds. They use X-ray diffraction to study the arrangement of molecules in crystals and find that the end groups of molecules in these compounds have a centrosymmetrical linkage. This leads to differences in the crystal habits and physical properties between odd and even numbered chain compounds.
